boardgame.name: The Banewarrens (5E)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An ancient storehouse of evil has been opened…

In the murky recesses of time, a powerful and benevolent cleric set upon a well-intentioned plan. In those days, evil was on the decline, and the forces of darkness had been routed in almost every field of battle. Danar Rotansin sought to finalize this defeat by gathering evil artifacts, objects of dark power, trapped essences of vanquished fiends, demonic relics, and even the last vestiges of particularly horrible diseases. He imprisoned these “banes” in a deep and powerful network of vaults, believing that to destroy them would release their evil back into the world.

But evil has its ways of subverting even the best among us, and Danar’s Rotansin’s path led toward darker destinies. His vaults, however, still remain deep beneath Ptolus. And now they are once again opened.

Can the PCs seal the Banewarrens before their contents make their way into the world once more? And who will help—or seek the dark treasures for themselves? The answers might seem surprising, and the PCs never know who to trust.

This dynamic mega-adventure sends the PCs down into the dungeons below Ptolus—and out into the streets. It pits the PCs against other Ptolus adventurers—some self-serving, some downright evil—in a race to seal the Banes before their horror is unleashed upon the world.

The Banewarrens is a mini-campaign set in Ptolus, Monte Cook's City by the Spire. It is suitable for 5e characters of roughly 6th level (potentially taking them up to 10th level or so), or Cypher System characters of roughly third tier.

boardgame.name: Bandits Jungle Machine Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Machinery lines the walls of this ruined, overgrown temple. Water runs through aqueducts while large cogs tick under the humming floor.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Pirates Flooded Temple Camp
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This pirate’s base is built into a temple in a cave by the sea, their entire pier and small port hidden by it. Boats float tied to different docks while further in statues watch over an ancient treasure maps.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ancient Jungle Temple Waterways
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An overgrown temple with rushing aqueducts running all the way through. Intricate floor tiles are cracked and littered with rubble.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Jungle Temple of Mechanical Depths
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined temple has giant rusted cogs whirring away and ticking under the floor. Everything’s overgrown and the floor falls down into darkness almost everywhere. Vines make unreliable bridges across the dark chasm below.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ancient Jungle Temple Machine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Machinery lines the walls of this ruined, overgrown temple. Water runs through aqueducts while large cogs tick under the humming floor.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Unique Items: Collection 10
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Whether found in a shop, as part of a treasure hoard in a dungeon, or simply in a ditch at the side of the road, feel free to add these unique items to your next gaming session. Some are magical, most are mysterious, some are less-than-interesting.

Items include:


A militia sword that won't cost you just coin, but your life as well
A fine evening gown that can increase - or decrease - the wearer's charisma
A wooden face frame that will help a weilder of nature's magic
Self-healing leather backpack, but is it worth it?

boardgame.name: Alina of the Arena
boardgame.description:
Source: The Game Website.
A roguelike deckbuilding tactics game that combines elements from 'Slay the Spire' and 'Into the Breach'. Play as a gladiator to survive. With roguelike deckbuilding and hex-based tactics, no longer bound by simple attack and defense. Make use of dodges and knockbacks to stay alive!

boardgame.name: Urban Wizards of the Mystical Underground
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

They wander the streets, living in fleabag hotels. Some are street corner prophets looking to bring salvation or condemnation. Some are looking for adventure. Others trying to save humanity from the horrors under the muck, under the streets. Others want to bring those horrors to the surface. Then there are those looking to become underground legends. They are wizards all, fighting to survive in a world unseen and unnoticed by the average person.

Urban Wizards of the Mystical Underground is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.
boardgame.rpg: Urban Wizards of the Mystical Underground

boardgame.name: 2 AM
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s 2 AM and you and your friends are drunk.
You require some food.
The convenience store is infested with demons.
You want a burrito bomb!

2 AM is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Animals Are People Too
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are animals.
You are constantly being mistake for human.
You are forced to live Human lives.
Deal with it.

Animals Are People Too is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: ANTI-CLAUS
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s June 15th.
In 10 days the Anti-Claus will come down to obliterate all cheerfulness.
You are Santa’s elves. You’ve been complacent for six months.

ANTI-CLAUS is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Bugs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It’s June 15th.
In 10 days the Anti-Claus will come down to obliterate all cheerfulness.
You are Santa’s elves. You’ve been complacent for six months.

ANTI-CLAUS is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Corporate Dinos
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are dinosaurs who were thought to be extinct.
You’ve joined the corporate world.
You just completed a “Success in Business” course.
It’s time to start climbing that ladder!

Corporate Dinos is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: SavannaScapes
boardgame.description:
Players take turns moving around the play area choosing species tiles and placing them next to others to provide those species with their needed habitats and create an ecosystem.

Point tokens are earned each time a player meets the needs of their animals or when an event tail is played. The player with the most points when all the rounds are complete wins.

boardgame.name: Desperate Monsters On Love Island!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are fantasy monsters taking a break from the dungeon to look for love.
You signed on to be a part of a matchmaking reality TV show,
You are on an island for 3 weeks and the cameras catch everything.
Is “that” one...The One?

Desperate Monsters On Love Island is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Earth's Last Hope
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are a team of z-list heroes.
All of the other heroes are out of the fight.
You are Earth’s last hope.
Earth's Last Hope is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Elves Gone Wild!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Publisher's blurb:

You are Elves from the North Pole.
You are sick and tired of working for Santa.
It’s Christmas Eve. You’ve stolen Santa’s sleigh.

Elves Gone Wild is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Mars Needs Winnebagos!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are little green men from Mars.
You’ve been sent to Earth to collect Winnebagos for your Emperor.
Why? Why not.

Mars Needs Winnebagos! is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Oh Cthulhu, You've Done it Again!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cthulhu dreams in his house at R'lyeh
Are you a match for Cthulhu’s dreams?
Hilarity ensues

Oh Cthulhu is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.
boardgame.rpg: Oh Cthulhu, You've done it again!

boardgame.name: Slay What?
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You’re a bunch of clerics.
A king has charged you with slaying something.
What are you slaying?
I don’t know.
Pray to your god, which ever one that is.

Slay What? is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: Stupid Gnomes
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gnomes are popping up everywhere.
Getting into your gardens.
Messing up your lawn.
What are you going to do bout it?

Stupid Gnomes is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.

boardgame.name: The Eccentric League of Science Fiction Authors!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are Science Fiction Authors.
You’ve banded together to fight Evil and save the World.
So get to it already will ya!

The Eccentric League of Science Fiction Authors is an open ended minimalist role playing game.

It requires a good deal of imagination.

It’s all about telling a story.
boardgame.rpg: The Eccentric League of Science Fiction Authors!

boardgame.name: Daa'argararath's Dungeon of Deathtrap Doorways!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You hug the wall of the thin cliff, praying that the quartet of Dark Walkers below you don't look up. One Dark Walker is bad enough, but four? How did you get in this mess?

You creep along the side of the wall, doing your best not to make any noise. You keep your eyes on your pursuers, feeling the way with your hand. After a few painfully slow inches of creeping, your hand lands on something wooden, not rock. You slowly move your gaze from the Dark Walkers to the door you've just found. A door? Who puts a door in the middle of a cliff half way up a mountain of rock? At this point you really don't care, as long as it opens.

boardgame.name: Bandits Temple of the Machine God
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined temple has giant rusted cogs whirring away and ticking under the floor. Bandits live in here, having set up the ruins as a base camp. Everything’s overgrown and the floor falls down into darkness almost everywhere.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Ancient Jungle Temple Walkways
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This ruined temple has had much of the ground fall away into pitch darkness below. Vines have grown into unreliable bridges, while at its heart stone statues guard a treasure map.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure prompt, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: Riot Police Commander: Assault! Asama Mountain Lodge
機動隊指揮官－強襲せよ！あさま山荘－
boardgame.description:
Riot Police Commander: Assault! Asama Mountain Lodge is a one-person exercise kit that deals with the final phase of the Asama Mountain Lodge incident, the hostage rescue operation on February 28, 1972.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asama-Sansō_incident

As the on-site commander, the player aims to completely control Asama Mountain Lodge. The exercise system refers to Avalon Hill's Squad Leader, especially for "units", "command ability" and "morale" in order to recreate the commander's influence, which was particularly noticeable in actual rescue operations.

In addition, the "Storm over System" (Area Impulse) was incorporated in the reproduction of the important aspect of "riot police battle", which is "eliminating barricades while suppressing extremists with water cannons and gas cylinders".

And besides, since the event cards reflect the "sudden incident" that occurred in the Asama Mountain Lodge incident, its impact can also be verified.

boardgame.name: The Great Library
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A huge library built from thick stone in a vast city. Ancient texts and esotectic scrolls can be found here amongst the clergy who tend to the tomes.

With this map and its detailed one-shot adventure, you’ll save so much time as you prepare for a fun session. The battlemap comes ready for both VTTs and easy home (or professional) printing—so you can use it no matter how you prefer to run your sessions!

boardgame.name: High School of the Dead
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Zday at L-Location. You arrive in this world already enrolled in a nondescript High School, somewhere in urban Japan...

The infection is worldwide, and within a week of the initial outbreak, even the President of the United States has been bitten (an infected soul got on board Air Force One). Pockets of resistance are sparse, and civic infrastructure is slowly grinding to a halt in the face of this catastrophe.

boardgame.name: House Rules: Autism Manifesto
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is an attempt to utilize Jumpchain in a Solo RPG storytelling framework, using jump documents, random generators, and original tables. If you're tired of a free-form Jumpchain, and want to try something more involved, this might be for you.

These house rules exist to make a chain more rich, through detail and unexpected events. That's the theory, anyway.

boardgame.name: Megamind Jumpchain CYOA
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the world of Megamind! A world of superheroes, and a world of supervillains! This is a glorious place, a place with HAM, CHEESE, and Superheroics!

The plot of the setting revolves around Metro City, a huge metropolis which is home to both the superhero Metro Man and the supervillain Megamind.

This is a pretty strange world, all told. People are just unbelievably blasé about things, and Prison officers let inmates keep any kids they find. But eh, cartoon logic!

boardgame.name: Heroes of the Storm
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Nexus. A conflux of time, space and even dimensions where heroes and worlds clash. Sounds like underwhelming science fiction, doesn’t it? Well, you better get used to it because for the next ten years, you’ll be right here in the thick of things.

boardgame.name: GUNNM
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

YOUR DREAMS FADE SLOWLY AS YOU AWAKEN

"It's a good thing I found you first. Those vultures would have decapped you and stuck you in a clunker before stopping to check for a pulse. And then good luck paying that debt off let me tell you..."

The voice fades in and out with the pounding pain in your head and lower body. From what understanding comes so soon after waking, you’re probably damned lucky you still feel pain. A dull pressure and sharp pinch against your arm, and waves of chemical well-being wash the agony away.

boardgame.name: Thieves' Honor
boardgame.description:
From the publisher:
Thieves’ Honor is an urban Side-Quest adventure that can be dropped into any game campaign quickly and easily. It is an offshoot of The Maps & Monstrum Compendium, coming to Kickstarter in June 2022, and it offers a series of loosely connected full-length adventures based on the maps of The Reclusive Cartographer. Thieves’ Honor is the first of many Side-Quest adventures that give GMs ready to run short quests adventures to use whenever needed.

boardgame.name: Technical Readout: Golden Century
boardgame.description:
“Those who break faith with the Unity shall go down to darkness.”

While the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere decimated each other over the shattered remains of the Star League and slid into the technological dark age of the Succession Wars, the Clans of Kerensky entered into a golden era of prosperity. Bereft of Nicholas Kerensky’s leadership, the Clans pushed their technological capabilities to their limits, developing devastating new weapons and technologies and flooding the battlefields of the Pentagon and Kerensky Cluster with powerful war machines as they trialed each other for supremacy.

Technical Readout: Golden Century unveils the weapons and technologies developed during a pivotal era in Clan history, when the Clans came of age and matured into what they are today. Technical Readout: Golden Century debuts the production and custom machines used by the Children of Kerensky in the early twenty-ninth and thirtieth centuries. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 29 new advanced and experimental BattleMechs, OmniMechs, vehicles, aerospace, battle armor and WarShip units ready for play. In addition, a complete section covers the experimental designs introduced by the nascent Clans immediately following the Pentagon campaign.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: Bad Sex Deck
boardgame.description:
Bad Sex Deck is a supplement for Bad Sex: The Roleplaying Game. It's used to randomly create playable scenarios including the location, the characters and why their sex is bad.

Bad Sex: The Roleplaying Game is a roleplaying game about bad sex. If you want to feel the cringe, embarrassment and humor of sex that goes bad, this is your game. In Bad Sex, the sex is always between consenting adults. They want to have sex with each other but for whatever reason, the results are mediocre at best, mortifying at worst.

All the information in the deck is replicated in the book in the form of tables so you don't have to buy it to play the game. You can also use it without the game if you need to randomly create bad sex scenarios for other reasons.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Vilniaus pramonės istorijos
boardgame.description:
Develop industry in XIX-XX c. Vilnius through different eras: rivers, rail and modern.
Each turn player will draw limited resources from the bag, and use them to build factories. Besides victory points factories allow to get production needed for other factories, to fulfill orders and long term projects. You can use factories of your opponents to help fulfil your orders faster, but you will give them extra resources.
Best industry developer wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Chasseur de Classe Rogue
Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Rogue-class Starfighter Expansion Pack
boardgame.description:
X-Wing 2nd ed.: Rogue-class Starfighter Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add two Rogue-class Starfighters to your Separatist or Scum and Villainy squadrons, including a beautifully painted miniature in the traditional Magnaguard color scheme, and another in the distinctive scheme of Xanadu Blood, the personal ship of notorious bounty hunter Cad Bane. The expansion also has four maneuver dials (two for each faction), and an assortment of tokens. Additionally, thirteen ship cards let you choose the pilots who fly this iconic starfighter into battle and seventeen upgrade cards invite you to customize your ship to fit your strategy.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Manhunt: The Onnesium Quest Vol. I
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Manhunt is an adventure module for MegaTraveller which takes your players on a quest for the legendary Victory Belt, an asteroid belt consisting entirely of the rare and expensive element onnesium-118. Only the basic three-volume MegaTraveller rules set is required to play Manhunt, and the referee should familiarize herself with both those rules and this module before play begins. Other MegaTraveller supplements and sourcebooks are available that will, though not essential, provide a wealth of further background information. Particularly useful is the Rebellion Sourcebook from GDW. Both of these provide the rich detail that made Traveller famous.

Manhunt was projected for publication in 1990, but its publisher DGP closed their doors before Manhunt saw print. Now, the original manuscript, recovered from a 3.5 inch floppy, has been rehabilitated and polished for publication.

boardgame.name: They Came From Camp Murder Lake! Twist Cards
boardgame.description:
They Came from Camp Murder Lake! is a They Came from Beyond the Grave! sourcebook for Players and Directors wanting to embrace the thrills and horrors of the 1970s and 1980s slasher movie genre, when arguably, it was at its peak.

They Came from Came Murder Lake! Twist Cards include a number of locations, characters, and actions, allowing Directors (and players!) to introduce sudden twists and plot revelations to an ongoing game.

- from the publisher's blurb
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: Along the Way: Mock Fey, Real Trouble
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Our Along the Way series of supplements provides the perfect side quests for groups to explore as a breather during longer-running campaigns or when the entire party isn’t available to tackle the next leg of an adventure.

In this encounter, a small faux fey from the Brass City is wreaking havoc on a tiny colony of mouzlings, and they need assistance from a band of heroes who can stop the invader before it drains away the magic of their leyline. This encounter is best suited for a party of four to five 3rd-level characters.

This supplement includes:

A full one-shot for 4-5 3rd-level characters.
Background information to provide depth for your encounter.
1 new hazard
4 new items
3 creature stat blocks
Maps for each floor (with day and night variants!)
A taunts table to help you embody the mischievousness of the brass cap!

boardgame.name: Beached Boat
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your adventuring career is off to a slow start as you travel the countryside. You've opted to move by the river towards the city when you come upon a strange sight, a beached boat. A quick hail has no response and the vessel appears to be abandoned. Seems like you have just obtained a vehicle!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign, for a single, second level PCs.

boardgame.name: The Avagnon Continent Guide
boardgame.description:
The Avagnon Continent Guide

Avagnon, the largest continent in the Magic Realm. A land of great civilization and ancient mysteries. A land of adventure, of high magic, brave heroes, and deadly monsters. Avagnon is a land of deep forests, dark jungles, scorching deserts, and frozen lands.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Book of Riddles
boardgame.description:
Secrets and tips for the Albion roleplaying game

In this book Game Masters will learn more about what’s going on behind the scenes in the three worlds of the game: the mortal world of Albion, the otherworld of Annwn, and the spirit world of Abred.

Uncover factions, big players and plots that can frame your characters’ stories, and more peculiar and terrible creatures they can meet along the way.

This is the long-awaited material that didn't make it into the Albion corebook - partly because of space and partly to hide it from players. There's big picture stuff that can frame stories; big reveals about the setting; write-ups of important characters of the otherworld; and more monsters, both spirit and all-too-physical.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: The Superverse (Champions 6E)
boardgame.description:
The Superverse is a superhero campaign sourcebook meant to evoke a Bronze Age feel in a modern-day setting. This version supports Champions Sixth Edition, a superhero tabletop RPG published by DoJ/HERO Games. Versions also exist for ICONS Assembled, SUPERS! Revised Edition, BASH! Ultimate Edition, and Supergame 3rd Edition.

Each system-specific sourcebook includes the following:


Stats and origins for The Freedom Ring and The Iron Gauntlet. These are the 5 superheroes and 7 supervillains originally appearing in The Freedom Ring and The Iron Gauntlet, which were character books for the first edition of SUPERS! back in 2012.



New Characters and Organizations. These include a government-sponsored superhero team (Vanguard America), five super-powered mobsters, three agencies (AEGIS, CHIMERA, UNICORN), 10+ supporting characters (these are non-powered citizens of Del Rey), and a few others.



Four interlinked adventures designed to introduce all of the above characters into your games while keeping your player characters at the forefront of the action. Thoroughly rooted in the setting, these adventures provide many options for role-playing, investigation, and combat.



A Timeline of the Superverse. This timeline is compiled from all of the character origins and adventure backgrounds included in the book. It should make it easier for GMs and players to get a sense of the setting’s backstory and fit their own characters into the universe.



The City of Del Rey. Del Rey is the fictionalized version of San Francisco where the aforementioned adventures are set. We’ve tried to provide enough flavor text to give the city some personality, but have shied away from creating an overly-determined setting. The chapter on Del Rey provides details on organizations, institutions, people, and places, but only those that might make an appearance during the sourcebook’s adventures. Our hope is that this approach will “leave enough blanks” for you to make the city your own.



Campaign Design Advice. This short section provides advice on how to make sure that player characters remain at the center of the narrative when running through a published universe.



Optional Rules (SUPERS! Revised only!). This includes a new option for Super Strength, minor tweaks to the Mook rules, and suggested changes for one or two Complications.


As much art as we can pack into the book! This includes art from the late (and definitely great) Joe Singleton, Ade Smith, Dan Houser, “Thetimmy,” Ayanna Regalado, and Athena Regalado.


Maps. These include maps for the following locations: The City of Del Rey, Stellar Labs, the Argyle Museum, ACME Iron Works, Black Rock Prison, the Del Rey County Jail, The Bayshore Shopping Center, Fort Wayne (military base), and a desert landing site. All of these are keyed to encounters in the sourcebook’s adventures.


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Cave-In
boardgame.description: The year is 1602 and the bank extends you a 50 pound loan. In a race against time and the elements, you venture into the world of mining. Drill, dig, smelt, sell, and keep ahead of your bank loan as you strive to strike it rich. Weigh your odds carefully before excavating to maximize profit while avoiding a CAVE-IN!

boardgame.name: Etna: Fires of Sicily
boardgame.description:
Trapped under Mt. Etna & chased by an ancient Sicilian philosopher, Players must use their unique abilities, manipulate the tomb and find artifacts to escape before the entire tomb collapses with them inside!

Key Concepts
Based on Sicilian history and myth
Educational
Variable Difficulty
Variable Layouts
Multiple Characters

Players take turns moving their explorers through the maze to find the four needed keys to escape the labyrinth. They must bring them to the other side of the labyrinth to unlock the exit and run back to the exit before the volcano drops down on them!

Each room has a different ability or instant action the players can use; both can be good or bad, and they won't know until they enter!

Players have multiple routes to move through and can use several abilities; the ability of the room they occupy, their unique ability, or they can search for artifacts that give them a one-time use ability. Or they can rotate a room to block the philosopher's way.

At the end of each player's turn, the Philosopher moves closer to the explorers. If he ever catches up with a player, a curse tracker moves toward a round tracker, giving him more movement each round; the trackers ever meet its game over!

At the end of a full round of players, the round tracker moves toward the curse tracker on the numbered board. If they ever touch, it's game over!

Once the exit is opened, the rooms fall apart behind them, flipping them over to the destroyed side. They all must rush back to the exit before they are trapped forever!

boardgame.name: Elevator Pitch
boardgame.description:
Players create and deliver Elevator pitches by associating concepts from pairs of Tech Deck cards. Players present a 1 to 3-minute pitch for a new product, service or project in a causal party game setting. Then, other players get to ask two questions about the pitch just delivered. Play in idea or competitive mode. An Elevator Pitch is a brief speech outlining an idea for a product, service or project. The name comes from the notion that the speech would be delivered in the short time period of an elevator ride. In the financial world, it is an entrepreneur's presentation to a venture capitalist to persuade them that a business idea is worth investing in.

OBJECTIVE – The objective is to create and deliver Elevator Pitches by associating concepts on pairs of Tech Deck cards.
THEME – The theme of the game is an entrepreneur creating the concept for a new product, service or company in modern era setting.
GAME PLAY – The players form teams if playing with more than 4 players. Pairs of concept cards from the Tech Deck are dealt to the table and players/teams get to select a pair of cards from which to create a concept for. Elevator pitches are delivered. Then, the other players get to ask the presenter two questions. In idea mode, the game ends after 10 pitches have been given. In competitive mode, other players vote on whether to fund the idea.
WINNING – In idea mode, there are no winners/losers. In competitive mode, the team/player with the most funded ideas wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Vexagon
boardgame.description:
In this move-and-capture game, simple rules lead to complex play. Up to six players race to get their pieces across a hexagonal field of play. The direction and distance of each move is set by the throw of two dice. You can obstruct your opponents by jumping over their pieces and sending them back to the start, but the evil twist is that you can choose to move another player's piece rather than your own. So for example player A might move player B's piece backwards, capturing one of player C's pieces in the process.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Refined Lantern Sword
boardgame.description:
Glossary Card, Gear Card and Weapon Proficiency Card that were included with the Willow First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box includes:

Photoresin Willow
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card, 1 Weapon Proficiency Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note
DeathPink Edition limited to 400: Deathpink authenticity note

Willow is the most talented swordmaster to appear in generations. Her adaptability, sense of balance, and inventiveness have taken the lives of many and captured the attention of more. The Hand itself has taken an interest. It waits patiently to either best her in combat, or for her life to end so that he may soak a memory quill in her brain. The Scribe is always pleased to add new techniques to the corpse-filled library.

boardgame.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Ashen Shears and Cleavage X
boardgame.description:
Glossary Card and Gear Card that were included with the Pascha First Run Collector's Edition that was not part of the based game.

The First Run Collector's Edition is enclosed in a hand-stamped kraft box includes:

Photoresin Pascha
1 x Hard Plastic Kingdom Death 30mm round insert and base
Large Matte Art Print
Character Art Card
Beta Rules - 1 x Glossary Card, 1 x Gear Card
First run collector's edition: Signed and numbered authenticity note
Deathgrey edition limited to 250: Deathgrey authenticity note

Pascha is a survivor from a settlement that primarily hunts Ashen Lagomorphs, also known as Milk Rabbits. What they lack in intelligence, they make up for in viscousness and a high capacity to breed. Milk Rabbits never stop growing, and their appetite increases with their size. Most die from madness, others from their front teeth getting so long they curl under their chin and cut their jugular.

Milk Rabbits have poor eyesight and scent, wearing fabrics and makeup made from their fur and fat is a great way to confuse them while on the hunt.

Pascha’s shears are specially made to cut dense Milk Rabbit fur that is so fluffy and matted it acts as a layer of armor!

Her settlement lives in fear and respect for the monster, often holding festivals to promote health, fertility, and a healthy body.

boardgame.name: メトロックス (MetroX): Sapporo & Kobe & Kyoto
boardgame.description:
In MetroX, players create subway networks by filling in the station spaces on their individual game sheets. Using the numbers revealed by the cards, all players fill up their subway map with ◯s in the station spaces. However, the number of times they can add stations to each line is limited, so they have to make tough choices. Players can score many points by getting their star bonuses in stations with many intersecting routes. Players also get bonuses by being the first to complete routes. Try to fill in all your stations to minimize the penalties and achieve a high score!

MetroX: Sapporo & Kobe & Kyoto includes three different maps to use with the rules in MetroX. Various gimmicks also appear, such as Kyoto with the largest number of lines, Sapporo with a ring road, Kobe with a huge station...

boardgame.name: Smash Up: Titans Event Kit – Winner's Prizes Saison 2
boardgame.description:
Prizes for the winner of tournaments organized as part of the Titans Season 1 release. The winner received:

• 1 Smash Up play mat
• 28 premium PV tokens
• 5 score markers

Participants received Smash Up: Titans Saison 2

boardgame.name: The Fiddler's Lament (PF2)
boardgame.description:
Music fit to wake the dead!

Music hath charms to soothe the savage breast, it's true, but some music truly is the devil's music. An orphan girl, now full-grown but still lost and alone, must face once more the tragic curse that destroyed her past. Will her darkling music bring ruin to the village she now calls her home? Can the heroes earn the townsfolk's trust, or must innocence be sacrificed for the heroes to save town from the mysterious hauntings that plague a village huddled in the shadow of an accursed ruin?

This dark fantasy adventure is perfect for 1st-level characters using Pathfinder Second Edition to add a dash of horror and fright to your campaign! Grab this 20-page PF2 adventure today and Make Your Game Legendary!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Cloudcaves
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cloudcaves is a 5e supplement which aims to help you save prep time and impress your players.

This product offers you a ready-to-use location, which you can drop in any setting, along with detailed encounters that can become an daventure. All of this supported by maps, to complement your game without the need to prepare.

Here's a summary of what you get in this product:

1 location with lore
3 detailed encounters that can become an adventure (4-6h of gameplay)
2 new stat block
1 custom artwork
3 battlemaps with ~40 versions (night, rain, etc)
1 regional map with 3 versions

boardgame.name: Dragons with Rocket Launchers
boardgame.description:
It's a peaceful summer's day on Dragon Island... or is it? A case of rocket launchers just washed onto shore!

Dragons with Rocket Launchers is a card game of frantically shooting rockets while fending off rockets coming in the player's direction. Each turn, a card is played affecting the state of the battlefield. When a Rocket Time card is played, all the rockets in play will move around the table and potentially eradicate some players.

Be the last dragon standing to win Dragons with Rocket Launchers!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Keepers: A beautiful game for clever people
boardgame.description:
In Keepers each player takes a turn as Curator, choosing one (can’t be a noun!) word to describe a card in their hand and announcing it. All players including the Curator then play a card that they think aligns the most, or the least, with that word, they are shuffled and placed face up to a numbered slot in middle of the table. All players then vote and the cards that get the most votes either way is a “Keeper” and earns the owner one point! Through clever word use by giving great clues one Curator will rise to the top and claim the most Keepers!

All artwork in Keepers has been hand selected from Byron Jorjorian’s portfolio of over 600,000 images of the natural world.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A Ghostly Affair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An unexpected inheritance, an old manor house and a dead man with a mysterious past. What could possibly go wrong? Right, you could end up being the focus of an ancient ritual that eventually devours your soul. Oh well…

This is a pulp horror adventure set in the 1920s or the victorian era. It was written for the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (SWADE) and features a Social Conflict and a Dramatic Task. It includes 5 pregenerated characters.

boardgame.name: A Village in Peril
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Somewhere in the Wild Lands in a small village, ordinary people live their ordinary lives. But the times are dark. A sorcerer seems to have gained power over a tribe of orcs. Will orcs burn down the village or will brave heroes stand in their way?

This is a classic fantasy one sheet that can be set in any world the GM wants. It was written for the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (SWADE) and features a Social Conflict and a Mass Battle.

boardgame.name: Beyond the Pile of Bones
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The war against the skeletal horde has been dragging on for months. The army of the king is making a stand at a large river, will they be able to stop the onslaught? And who will eventually dare to venture beyond the pile of bones left behind after the battle to bring this war to an end?

This is a dark fantasy tale about heroes in a desperate world who risk everything to defeat evil. The heroes should be Seasoned rank and include at least one cleric or paladin. It was written for the Savage Worlds Adventure Edition (SWADE) and features a Mass Battle, Travel and a Dramatic Task.

boardgame.name: 18Namibia
boardgame.description:
18Namiba is a strategic economy game, which reflects the devlopment of the railway network in today Namibia during the late 19th and early 20th century.

Players invest in railway companies. The latter create a railway network with track tiles on the game board. They run these routes with their trains and thereby generate income. The amount depends on the economic potential of the cities and long-distance routes served. The player with the most shares in a railway company is its director. They decide whether these incomes will be distributed to the shareholders as a dividend or whether it will be added to the companies' treasury for future investments.

As the name of the game already indicates, 18Namibia belongs to the 18xx games. A specific element is the auctioning of railway concessions, which gives the owner certain advantages but which also entail an obligation. The technical progress is represented with 9 consecutive types of trains. This represents a special challenge for the directors, since only a careful investment policy leads to success.

18Namibia is based on 1895 Namibia which was designed for 3 players. With the introduction of another railway company and two mining companies, the game is now also suitable for 4 players. In addition, a version for two players is included.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Corsairs of Cthulhu Map Folio
boardgame.description:
User Summary:

This set of 20 maps and player handouts is intended as an accessory for the Corsairs of Cthulhu: Fighting Mythos in the Golden Age of Piracy campaign.

boardgame.name: Tales From the Trek
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ever wanted to make your travels between locations more interesting without having to slog through it? This alternative set of rules for traveling between locations that gets the whole group involved in a part-narrative, part-mechanical mini-game where the players get to tell the story of what happened on their journey.

boardgame.name: Game Master's Guide to Rites and Rituals
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Epic World Building for 5th Edition (5e) Game Masters!

Want to run realistic rites and rituals that bring your game world to life? Now you can!
Inside this 5e handbook, you'll find exciting ideas and inspiration for:

Rites and Festivals (for most fantasy religions)
Rules for Arcane and Divine Magic Rituals
Rules for Fortune Tellers and Psychics (including detailed predictions)
40 Omens and 100 Prophecies (plus random tables to generate your own)
New Magic Items and Nonmagical Equipment
Random Tables for Naming Temples, Festivals, Rites, Rituals, Arcane/Divine organizations, etc.

Plus Sympathetic Magic rules to create more powerful spells with:

Voodoo Dolls and Effigies
Blood, Hair, and Nail Clippings, etc.
True Names
Weather and Terrain-Based Magic that make environments more challenging and fun

boardgame.name: The Rank Game
boardgame.description:
Each round: One player is the ranker, and other players are guessers.

Whichever guesser comes closest to the ranker’s choices wins. It couldn’t be easier. Play one round, or many!

boardgame.name: Twisted Serpents
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Word spreads quick through the occult underground. Hedge mages, necromancers, and tomb robbers all know about it: the king needs some monster slayers. Perhaps you have heard also that several of his knights were slain over the weekend? This must be why. No ordinary exterminators can handle his current problem, so he’s gone in search of a specialist. Even the wizards from his royal college seem shaken when you show up to accept the job.

The king’s personal waterfowl preserve has been infected by some sorcerous malignancy. The beautiful, fat ducks and quail that should have graced his majesty’s feasting table have become twisted, man-eating monstrosities. Now their bodies are like twisting coils — engorged and discoloured, repelling the points of swords. Their now-gigantic beaks kill men and beasts alike. No one knows how this happened or how to get rid of them. Perhaps you can solve this mystery?

boardgame.name: Lamentations of the Marsh Hag
boardgame.description:
An evil hag, slain by heroes in times of old, has risen in MurkWaters again to wreak havoc.
I this card-based expansion for Four against Darkness, instead of rolling on tables to generate places and encounters, the player(s) draw cards from a deck and apply the results to the adventure.

The deck contains:
17 tarot-size, full color cards
Instructions are included on the cards
2 unique monster cards
2 unique magic item cards

boardgame.name: Hazardous Movement Scenario Pack 1: A World at War
boardgame.description:
Hazmo's debut scenario pack, A World at War, consists of 10 scenarios compatible with the Advanced Squad Leader game system. A description of each scenario is detailed on the image of the back cover above. A wide variety of combatants (including - but not limited to - Russians, Germans, SS, Free French, British, Italians, Japanese and Chinese) and terrain types (including city, bocage, countryside, hill and village) will challenge even seasoned players' skills, while the high fun and replay potential of each scenario will provide you with unmatched value for your purchase. Finally, reliable player support on this website will supply you with answers to any questions you may have. In this way, Hazmo aims to optimize your gaming experience!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Simple Space Ship System
boardgame.description:
A miniatures focused wargame with simple rules for space opera style armada versus armada combat, for any number of players. The game emphasizes and promotes players to make their own miniatures to represent their armadas, using any material they have available at any skill level.

Players start the game by allocating a number of unit points to create an armada compliment to battle with. Each player has the same unit value. Players take turns making actions with up to 5 ships of their ship, and an additional 2 with a special rule. They roll multiple six-sided dice to determine if ships become damaged. Once a ship takes 4 damage tokens it is destroyed. The game is played until one person surrenders or all of their units are destroyed.

The game is distributed as a book with no components, and players are encouraged to source pieces from gaming shops. Simple Space Ship is played on a field of any size, any foregoes all movement measurement mechanics. Players are free to move their units to any position they choose, simulating very fast moving spacecraft.

The book contains the rules of play, as well as a chart which tracks play over multiple gameplay sessions through it's legacy mechanic.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sunshine City
boardgame.description:
The future is now! Turn your thriving metropolis into an eco-friendly paradise by upgrading your buildings, creating new technology, and getting support from public and private sectors.

Sunshine City is a roll-and-write-and-move for any number of players. Each turn, roll 2 dice: all players move one of their three workers (builder, inventor, or lobbyist) based on the lower die roll, then a different worker based on the higher die roll, gaining resources in whichever of your city’s seven districts they land in.

Builders spend resources increasing your city’s production. Inventors spend them on special abilities. Lobbyists gain support for projects, which give access to powerful one-off powers.

The first player to build seven solar farms in their city is the winner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Planetary Profiteers
boardgame.description:
Ad astra ad lucrum! You each represent a different culture from a solar system where competition for dominance among your peoples has been the norm for centuries. Now rivals have come together (barely) to send your team on a voyage to negotiate with worlds new to you to build an interplanetary confederation and earn commissions.

You are each in this for yourselves, yet you will somehow have to work together to complete missions. The player with the highest commission point total at the end of the game is the winner.

boardgame.name: Eldritch Energies - Phantasmal Filters Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Eldritch Energies is part of the Wildlands wilderness terrain series. These are filters for use with Dwarven Forge light panels and light pucks. This item was initially available as an add-on during the Wildlands Kickstarter.

Eldritch Energies comes with these 6 pieces:
(1) Faerie Water - Phantasmal Filter 8x8
(1) Faerie Water - Circular Overlay
(1) Eerie Emanation - Phantasmal FIlter 8x8
(1) Eerie Emanation - Circular Overlay
(1) Spiraling Styx - Phantasmal Filter 8x8
(1) Spiraling Styx - Circular Overlay

boardgame.name: DF Floor Fogger
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
DF Floor Fogger is part of the Wildlands wilderness terrain series. The fogger is a tile that holds a small amount of water and emits “fog” when activated. This item was initially available as an add-on during the Wildlands Kickstarter.
DF Floor Fogger comes with one DF Floor Fogger

boardgame.name: The Light Puck
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
The Light Puck is part of the Wildlands wilderness terrain series. It is made of "Dwarvenite" and includes multiple LEDs to light a circle. It comes with a USB charging cable. The LED is Bluetooth controllable with a smartphone, tablet, or computer. This item was initially available as an add-on during the Wildlands Kickstarter.

The Light Puck comes with one Dwarven Light Puck

boardgame.name: Wildlands Ranger
boardgame.description:
User Summary:
Wildlands Ranger is part of the Wildlands wilderness terrain series. It is made of "Dwarvenite" and includes some metal and magnetized parts. Some parts have LED circuitry (switch, battery, and socket) to support LED lighting attachments. This item was initially available as a pledge level during the Wildlands Kickstarter. The item comes in both painted and unpainted versions.

Wildlands Ranger essentially consists of all three of the following sets: Explore the Forest, Explore the Mountains, and Explore the Swamp. An extra set of stretch goal pieces was included for each terrain set, but only one Archaean Compass and tote bag as those were provided one a one-per-backer issue instead of with each set.

Wildlands Ranger comes with these 250 pieces:
(1) Floating Log
(1) Gator Skull (Pole Accessory)
(2) Saluting Seraph (Pole Accessory)
(1) Planar Pylon (LED)
(1) Archaean Glowglobe (LED)
(3) Seal of Binding (Magnetic Accessory)
(2) Wyvern Skull Cairn
(5) Archaean Mana-Stave (Pole Accessory)
(3) Reality Rupture (Magnetic Accessory)
(1) Balefire Lantern (LED)
(8) Mossy Rock Mound
(2) Magnetic Boulder
(2) Tripwire
(2) Whipping Stakes Trap (Pole Accessory)
(4) Grasping Skeletal Hand
(2) Stepped Stump Crag
(2) Oblong Crag
(1) Rocky Bridge
(2) Wyverstone Spires
(2) Suspended Perch
(8) Rock Cluster
(3) Rocky Endcap
(4) Small Driftstone
(1) Medium Driftstone

boardgame.name: The Color Scheme
boardgame.description:
The Color Scheme is a game of memory, maneuvers and manipulations.

In this 2-player game each player attempts to be the first to decipher a color code that was created by their opponent. A sharp focus is essential for each successful move. Players have to try and not be distracted by the shifting of cubes. Each opponent is scheming to outwit the other. The winning player will have to stay one step ahead to win!

Elegantly designed with a real wood game board and player pieces, the game also includes a drawstring bag == all stored within a magnetic flap-front box.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bliaron 2nd Edition
boardgame.description:
Bliaron 2nd Edition is a fantasy tabletop role-playing game of spiritual magic and bronze-age political, ideological and cultural tensions. With over 15 years of development, Bliaron has matured into a ripe, powerful and complete game that is suitable for both beginners and experienced gamers alike. It’s a game for those who want to be drawn in by a rich fantasy story, and not be bogged down by slow, complex or hard-to-understand rules.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Redemption: Decisive Action
boardgame.description:
Since the Battle of Zanzibar, the Terran Sphere and the Shohan have mired in a war of feint and maneuver. Now that time is coming to an end. Learning from their victories and defeats, both sides commit fully to the fray. It is the dawn of grand strategies across the theater of war, time for spies and soldiers to risk it all in the name of victory. It is time for Decisive Action!

Decisive Action is a resource for players and GMs, adding new plot hooks, adventure seeds, and equipment to a tumultuous galaxy. Alternate paths are also presented to ease integration into existing campaigns.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Crash Zone
boardgame.description:
A strange earthquake rocks tectonically-dead Mars. Unscheduled impacts have been recorded striking outside the normal crash zone, and little of it is ice. The team has been hired to get to the bottom of this mystery. Will they solve it in time, or will the Mars Terraforming Project die in its cradle?

Crash Zone is an action horror adventure supplement for Shadows Over Sol. It features a thrilling exploration and assault scenario, and is designed to run from two to four gaming sessions.

Designed for use with Shadows Over Sol: Science Fiction Horror Roleplaying.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Catilus' Tome of Curious Creations: Madam Catifa's Caravan of Magic Wonders
boardgame.description:
Come One, Come All, the Caravan is Here!

Enter Madam Catifa's Caravan of Magic Wonders and discover:


Amazing and unique magic items, all with full illustrations by acclaimed fantasy artist Catilus!
Extra rules, including: leveling items, complications, antagonists, and more, to keep surprising your players each time they encounter one of these items
Gamemaster tips to create exciting roleplaying opportunities and story hooks around these items
Myths, legends, and lore about the items
Sales pitches by the legendary sorceress and trademistress * Madam Catifa herself!
Rules to buy from, sell to, and haggle with Madam Catifa!


Madam Catifa’s Caravan of Magic Wonders is traveling across the world (some say across multiple worlds), trading in rare, curious, quirky, and powerful magic items. You never know where the caravan might appear next, but when it does, rest assured that accomplished heroes and aspiring adventurers alike will seek it out.

In this Catilus' Tome of Curious Creations, gamemasters and players alike will find a diverse assortment of magic items from different backgrounds to reward heroes, empower villains, and create excellent story hooks for incredible adventures. Some items may be hidden in forgotten temples, some may be wielded by nefarious enemies, and some may be sold by Madam Catifa herself.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Potion Making
boardgame.description:
You inherit the old potion shop from your ancestors. now, it is a great timing of potion making!!

Potion Making …plays like a roll-and-write dice game, but without dice. It is a Flip-and-write game.

Representative reveal a material card from the top of the deck. These materials are appeared as primary number. You refer that number and take an action to your own sheet.
You may try to make a BINGO line, or use that number to upgrade Magical Pots.　You can also “compound” new numbers.

Because of the communal actions, game play is simultaneous. It means that, Potion Making is playable for large groups of players.

boardgame.name: Fate of the Oracle
boardgame.description:
Fate of the Oracle is a complete 5e adventure for characters of 1st to 5th level. It uses the ENNIE Award Winning Arkadia Setting and is compatible with any setting inspired by the history and myths of Ancient Greece.

The adventure book has over 70 pages of densely packed Greek themed adventure content, set in a bronze age world of heroes and monsters. The layout is familiar and accessible, cast in the mold of official campaigns, it is easy to run with little preparation or adapt to make your own.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Clash of Carriers
boardgame.description:
The Battle of Midway was fought between seven carriers. Compare this to the Battle of the Philippine Sea which featured a total of 24 carriers on both sides! It was simply the largest carrier battle of all time which will never be surpassed.

Clash of Carriers, by designer Mark Stille, portrays this epic battle. The historical result saw the Japanese carrier force shattered, never to recover for the rest of the war. While this showdown is almost always treated as a one-sided affair, in this game players will have every opportunity to better the historical outcome or maybe even even reverse history.

The Japanese player can use the superior range of his carrier- and land-based aircraft in coordinated waves to hit the US Navy while his fleet maneuvers out of US aircraft range. Historically, despite poor aircraft coordination, many Japanese aircraft broke through the US fighter screen to attack US carriers. What could better coordination accomplish?

The American player can opt for an offensive strategy with a number of task groups to try and inflict even more massive losses on the Japanese naval force instead of settling for defeating the Japanese air strikes. US submarines inflicted losses and tracked Japanese fleet movements -- can they do so again, or will Japanese counter-measures foil historical results?

boardgame.name: Blasting Billy
boardgame.description:
Divide the loot from a bank robbery! But beware… Gang leader Blasting Billy is greedy and wants more loot than you. You only survive if you give the gang leader more than yourself. Other than that, it's every man for himself. Whoever takes the most points and survives Blasting Billy wins the game!

The Wild West in 1860…

As a member of Blasting Billy's savage outlaw gang, you've just completed the bank robbery of a lifetime. The loot is huge. But there is a problem. Gang boss Blasting Billy doesn't like to share! Anyone who claims more loot than Blasting Billy is out of luck.
With Blasting Billy you have to deal cards smartly. The cards come in five suits. Each turn you can choose from three actions: lay the card in front of yourself, donate the card to Blasting Billy by placing it on the table with the correct color pile, or discard the card. At the end of the game it is checked how much Blasting Billy has gained in value per color. Anyone who has a higher card value in a certain suit is immediately out. Whoever stays alive with the highest value wins.
Blasting Billy is a hilarious card game in which bluffing and clever math play a major role. If you can guess what your opponents are up to, you win the game. Do you know how to befriend Blasting Billy?

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: Title: Blasting Billy Publisher: 999 Games Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: RPG Nasty
boardgame.description:
Shameful! Repulsive! Offensive! Disgusting! The next game in the Rememorex Line, RPG NASTY, is a short-form storytelling zine-style game designed to evoke the bottom-of-the-barrel VHS horror of the early 80s. These schlocky masterpieces were known in Britain as the moral panic of the Video Nasties! In this one-shot game you and your group will collaborate to create a crazy slasher and play the hapless victims. Don’t expect to survive: you rack up valuable Tracking Errors by dying in the most gross, stupid, over-the-top ways. In RPG Nasty, dying is where the fun starts.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Savage Company Field Manual
boardgame.description:
Find all of the rules and essential information from the Savage Company Campaign Setting in this condensed printer friendly reference manual!

The Field Manual contains all of the vital content from the Campaign Setting, without art, short stories, and extra lore and fluff.

This is a stripped down version that is ideal for referencing rules, items, classes, races, and iconics quickly mid-game.

Step into the world of Savage Company and experience fast-paced vehicle action while gunning down your enemies. The Savage Company Field Manual includes:


New combat rulesets
Eight new and reimagined races
Nineteen new classes and archetypes
Over sixty new weapons
New spells, feats, and skills
New vehicle rules
Rolling road combat
Modular vehicles with hundreds of combinations
Airships
Ten iconic characters
Gear, equipment, and alchemical items
Violence, explosions, and much more!


- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Savage Company Campaign Setting (PF1)
boardgame.description:
Orcs! Guns! Vehicles! Time to join the big green war machine and march into hundreds of pages of new military style content!
Place the vibrant boomtown of Tombstone in your current world and open up all kinds of paramilitary adventures and mercenary options that are compatible with your existing games.

Step into the world of Savage Company and experience fast-paced vehicle action while gunning down your enemies.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Savage Company Campaign Setting (5e)
boardgame.description:
The bestselling Savage Company book finally comes to 5th Edition!

Orcs! Guns! Vehicles! Time to join the big green war machine and march into hundreds of pages of new military style content!
Place the vibrant boomtown of Tombstone in your current world and open up all kinds of paramilitary adventures and mercenary options that are compatible with your existing games.

Step into the world of Savage Company and experience fast-paced vehicle action while gunning down your enemies.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Savage Company Holiday Special
boardgame.description:
High above the streets of New Quark City a team of terrorists have seized a building, taken hostages, and declared war.

One set of friends have managed to escape... A group of off-duty mercenaries on vacation hiding somewhere inside.

They're alone, tired... and the only chance anyone has got.
Do they have what it takes to decease difficultly?

A one-night adventure for four 7th level characters, with a free map!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Savage Company The Chair
boardgame.description:
This free PDF contains a new short story, new artwork, and ten new items!

Do you have what it takes to become the new Tombstone Heavyweight Champion?

This supplement was created as a player community requested project, we hope you have as much fun as we did coming up with it.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Savage Company Recruit Orientation Guide
boardgame.description:
The Savage Company Recruit Orientation Guide is a great way to introduce yourself to the amazing world of the Savage Company Campaign Setting. It contains 4 iconic characters, their stories, artwork, race, class, and all the new equipment each one is carrying. As well as detailed information about the setting and each section of the complete campaign setting. If you want to play some Savage Company now, everything you need to get started is right here: for free.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: G-Core X
boardgame.description:
Ten years ago G-Core was born from the 4C/FASERIP system. Over 100+ modules later, multiple setting and genre books, G-Core has reached year 10. Presented here is G-Core X, a complete super hero rules system that allows for a variety of game styles. Play a feeble little man to a high god like Zeus! Run fun comedy games to terrifying horror! G-Core X offers all of that and more.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Geen JA geen NEE: mini spel
boardgame.description:
You say Yes or No more often then you think.

But in this game this will be punished immediately. Your opponents try's to get a Yes or No by asking smart questions.

But if you keep a clear head and answer clever, you win the card.

Who has the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

boardgame.name: Danger Bingo
boardgame.description:
Imagine the classic format – a room full of fun-loving people, each with their own bingo card, a lively caller wielding a rotating bingo ball machine. Now this is where it gets interesting. The timeless bingo calls have all been updated *gasp* with a series of outlandish forfeits!

The bingo game where the more you win, the more you lose
Classic bingo calls have been turned into hilarious forfeits.
Just make sure you don't get BINGO!
Includes bingo ball machine, check board, cards and tokens

The one, who don't get bingo or the last player wins the game!

boardgame.name: Roscoe Turner Air Race Game
boardgame.description:
Simple "Roll and Move" dice game simulating airplane races of the 1920-40s. Game consists of 6 airplane miniatures and a board representing the race course. In turn/position order players move their planes forward "dice roll" number of spaces avoiding other players and occasionally encountering beneficial or detrimental spaces on the race course. First plane crossing the finish line (after a predetermined number of laps) wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Prince August Fantasy Adventure Game
boardgame.description:
The rules was included in a Prince August catalogue from the 1980-ish. It´s a simple set of rules for fantasy wargaming. The battle take place on a 3´x3´ battlefield table with terrain of your choice.

Sequence of play

Both players write new orders, rally troops.
Both players move each unit according to orders.
Combat: (A. Missile fire, B. Hand-to-hand (melee), C. Mind combat and magic).
Morale: Check morale and move units accordingly.
Movement 2: Move any or all units again 2" or 3"


For each unit of the player on the board both players must write orders, corresponding to what he/she wants each unit to do in the course of the battle. A unit without orders cannot move. A unit cannot receive new orders unless it has a leader with it. All units must follow orders.

Mind combat is resolved before spells are cast. Only wizards may attempt to take over another creature´s mind.

The winner of the game is the one winning the battle.

The rules includes a battle scenario between the "Army of Neldoreth" (humans) and the "Gurthang´s Army" (undead).

Army of Neldoreth
1 King
1 Superhero
2 Heros
3 Wizards
24 Spearman
12 Bowmen

Gurthang´s Army
1 Gurthang
1 Sub-general on horse
10 Skeleton cavalry
15 Wraiths
24 Skeletons
35 Undead warriors

boardgame.name: The Realm of the Gateway: The Complete Series
boardgame.description:
The Realm of The Gateway is a fantasy/science fantasy role playing game set on the mythical world of Uylande.

It is a world trapped inside a dimensional portal between the dimensions of science and magic. Half the world obeys the physical laws of magic, while half the world obeys the physical laws of science. Where the two meet is a land of chaos called the Death Zone.

This is the complete set of The Realm of the Gateway. Within these covers are the rules for the complete trilogy: The Magic Realm, The Science Realm and The Death Zone.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Pioneer Rails
boardgame.description:
In Pioneer Rails, you represent a railroad owner who has seen an opportunity to expand your empire across the new lands of the frontier. You’ll be competing with other railroad owners to plan your railway in the best way possible to connect establishments to the railroad and satisfy the demands of the locals.

Pioneer Rails is a Flip & Write game where you’ll use poker cards to extend your railway tracks and build a poker hand at the same time.

Each turn you’ll choose one of the revealed poker cards. The suit of the card helps you extend your railway, connecting you to new towns and surrounding features. When you connect to a town, you’ll gain the ability to do a one time bonus. When you surround a feature with your tracks, you’ll activate it for end game scoring. The value of the card is added to your poker hand, which you'll score additional points for at the end of the round.

Each game you’ll also be competing over 3 goals, meaning every game you’ll be pulled in different directions.

The mechanism of surrounding features to activate them gives Pioneer Rails a satisfying ‘puzzley’ feel to the game. The variable objectives and the poker cards give enough replayability so no two games are ever the same.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Arctic Survival
boardgame.description:
Arctic Survival is a 2-4 player game of predator and prey that takes place on a ‘tundra’ of 25 cards arranged in a 5x5 grid. One team plays as lemmings, who move beneath the tundra searching for food and water to bring back to their burrow. The other team plays as foxes, who hunt on top of the tundra trying to dig up and catch the lemmings.

On the lemming turn, lemmings will roll, move, tunnel (by flipping cards) and search for resources. On the fox turn, foxes will roll, move, listen for lemmings, and pounce (by flipping cards in the opposite direction of the lemmings).

There are also adaptations and natural events hidden that can help the lemmings or foxes respectively and additional player tokens of the carrion beetle and polar bear that can change the tide of the game.

The game is designed to be both educational and fun. It can be used to teach about ecosystems, food chains, adaptations, abiotic and biotic elements, and the impacts of climate change.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Talented Cleric
boardgame.description:
Know That I am a Servant of the Gods!
Clerics are an iconic part of fantasy roleplaying games and, as agents of the divine, serve an important role in telling interesting stories and creating interesting worlds. Unfortunately, despite the many and varied different gods in most campaigns, clerics end up being disappointingly similar. Each selects two domains, but otherwise has access to the same spells, weapons, armor, and abilities as every other cleric. For characters devoted to divine beings that are spectacularly diverse, clerics have very little flexibility. But now with The Genius Guide to the Talented Cleric, it’s possible to build any kind of cleric. Warrior priests and crusaders can focus on divine domains and blessings, choosing to forgo the power to channel energy, or even reducing their dependence on spells. Clerics of gods focusing on animals can gain trusted mounts or improved familiars. Clerics of gods of knowledge can focus on secret lore and esoteric studies. Maintaining the core concept of a supernaturally-empowered agent of the gods, the Talented Cleric can now be as customized and unique as the god she worships.

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: More Cleric Talents
boardgame.description:
The concept of cleric talents (and why they are a good idea) is first presented in The Genius Guide to the Talented Cleric, along with a large number of talents (many adapted from the abilities of cleric archetypes and hybrid classes). The new talents presented here can be used with that book, or added as new options for the traditional cleric class. With the extra options, a cleric can gain power as the leader of a cult, gain favor from her god by making sacrifices, and cut deals with supernatural creatures other than her god, all while remaining the voice and hand of her chosen divinity!

- from the publisher's blurb

boardgame.name: Waste Knights: Second Edition – Tales From The Outback
boardgame.description:
The Waste is in turmoil. New challenges arise as old technologies, strange cults and pre-Scourge secrets return to haunt the survivors of the apocalypse. From the war-torn west to the struggling east, the inhabitants of ruined Australia are longing for a moment of respite.

Will you be the one to grant it? Will you face the unknown threats to prove human superiority? Or maybe you will seize the opportunity and grab what you can before everything goes to hell? Time to prove your mettle against fearsome enemies and impossible dangers. Time to show everyone that your deserve to be called a Waste Knight!

INSIDE THE BOX:


4 new Knights (Reverend Evans (Priest), Frank Strzelecki (Judge), Lisa Gomez (Scout), Warragul (Mercenary) with accompanying components (miniatures, sheets and upgrade cards)
4 new Vehicles to get you exactly where you want to go
The Guide and the Book of Tales featuring 4 new adventures, from co-op ones such as Rise of the Red Lord to competitive race found in Deadly Cargo along with their special cards, tokens and markers
New rules featuring Landmarks for even better immersion in the setting, Parts enabling you to pimp up your ride, and City Tasks that provide you with more open-world gameplay
New Wasteland Cards, tokens and markers for more variety whenever you ride out to the Waste


—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Una civilización en 45 minutos
boardgame.description:
Become the Master of the World by establishing and leading a civilization from the dawn of man to the space age. Discover new technological advances key to the development of humanity and build the most powerful empire the world has ever known.

A card game for 1-4 players (best with 2). Exchange technology advances with the shared card tableau to develop your civilization. Exchange Exploration and Gather cards with the shared tableau to expand your civilization and to gather the raw materials to invest in progressing your technology.
